utils.data_loading.fetch_data(url: str) → Dict¶

Fetch data from a given URL.

Parameters:

url (str) – API endpoint URL.

Returns:

JSON response.

Return type:

dict

utils.data_loading.fetch_fixtures_data() → List[Dict]¶

Fetch fixtures data.

utils.data_loading.fetch_fpl_data() → Dict¶

Fetch general FPL data.

utils.data_loading.fetch_player_gw_data(player_id: int) → List[Dict]¶

Fetch player gameweek data from the Fantasy Premier League API.

Parameters:

player_id (int) – Player ID.

Returns:

List of gameweek data for the player.

Return type:

list

utils.data_loading.save_to_csv(df: DataFrame, output_folder: str, filename: str)¶

Save the DataFrame to a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame to save.

  • output_folder (str) – Directory to save the CSV file.

  • filename (str) – Name of the CSV file.

  • teams_path (str) – Path to the teams CSV file.

utils.data_visualization module¶

utils.data_visualization.update_fixtures_difficulty(fixtures_difficulty_df: DataFrame) → Figure¶

Updates the Fixtures Difficulty Rating heatmap.

Parameters:

_ (str) – Placeholder argument for triggering the callback.

Returns:

A heatmap showing fixture difficulty ratings by gameweek.

Return type:

plotly.graph_objects.Figure

utils.data_visualization.update_ict_index(player1: str, player2: str, ict_index_df: DataFrame) → Figure¶

Updates the ICT Index Breakdown radar chart for the selected players.

Parameters:

  • player1 (str) – The name of the first selected player.

  • player2 (str) – The name of the second selected player.

Returns:

A radar chart comparing ICT metrics for the selected players.

Return type:

plotly.graph_objects.Figure

utils.data_visualization.update_player_cost_performance(selected_team: str | None, selected_position: str | None, selected_budget: float | None, player_cost_performance_df: DataFrame) → scatter¶

Updates the Player Cost vs. Performance scatter plot based on selected filters.

Parameters:

  • selected_team (str) – The selected team name.

  • selected_position (str) – The selected player position.

  • selected_budget (float) – The selected budget limit.

Returns:

A scatter plot showing player cost vs. performance.

Return type:

plotly.graph_objects.Figure

utils.data_visualization.update_player_performance(player1: str, player2: str, player_performance_df: DataFrame) → Figure¶

Updates the Player Performance chart for the selected players.

Parameters:

  • player1 (str) – The name of the first selected player.

  • player2 (str) – The name of the second selected player.

Returns:

A line chart comparing the players’ performance across gameweeks.

Return type:

plotly.graph_objects.Figure
